citations.narrative:
Per the licensee, on October 21, 2023 an eight month old male kangaroo was attacked by a fourteen week old female
fennec fox. The licensee explained that on this day she set up the designated area where the public participates in animal
interactions that included the kangaroo and the fennec fox. She placed the fox on the ground of the room and hung the
pouch that contained the 8 month old male kangaroo on the wall. She then left the animals unattended for approximately
5 minutes. Upon her return, there was blood on the fennec fox’s face and the kangaroo’s ears were injured and bleeding.
The licensee then obtained veterinary care for the kangaroo and, during this inspection, it was observed that the ears had
healed with sections missing, scaring and damage as a result of this encounter. This includes a left ear containing a small
¼ cm long section missing and a right ear missing the top 1/4 of the ear and three ½-1 cm long cuts into the ear. Lack of
adequate conditions while the animals were on exhibit resulted in injury of the kangaroo. Animals that are exhibited
together must be maintained in adequate conditions to include compatibility and sufficient supervision.
Corrective actions were implemented prior to this inspection on: 12/20/2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.131(d)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
Per the licensee, on October 21, 2023 an eight month old male kangaroo was attacked by a fourteen week old female 
fennec fox. The licensee explained that on this day she set up the designated area where the public participates in animal 
interactions that included the kangaroo and the fennec fox. She placed the fox on the ground of the room and hung the 
pouch that contained the 8 month old male kangaroo on the wall. She then left the animals unattended for approximately 
5 minutes. Upon her return, there was blood on the fennec fox’s face and the kangaroo’s ears were injured and bleeding. 
The licensee then obtained veterinary care for the kangaroo and, during this inspection, it was observed that the ears had 
healed with sections missing, scaring and damage as a result of this encounter. This includes a left ear containing a small 
¼ cm long section missing and a right ear missing the top 1/4 of the ear and three ½-1 cm long cuts into the ear. Lack of 
adequate conditions while the animals were on exhibit resulted in injury of the kangaroo. Animals that are exhibited 
together must be maintained in adequate conditions to include compatibility and sufficient supervision.  
Corrective actions were implemented prior to this inspection on: 12/20/2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
